prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The object has a central hole that runs through its length. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the following location: - Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.0857, 0.0) This newly created coordinate system will serve as the base for this part's construction. Sketching Face 1 Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Divide the sketching process into three loops. Loop 1: Top Circle 1. Draw a circle using the following parameters: - Center: (0.375, 0.375) - Radius: 0.375 Loop 2: Central Hole Circle 1. Draw a circle using the following parameters: - Center: (0.375, 0.5893) - Radius: 0.0643 Loop 3: Curved Side Arc and Line 1. Draw an arc using the following parameters: - Start Point: (0.3193, 0.4071) - Mid Point: (0.375, 0.3107) - End Point: (0.4307, 0.4071) 2. Draw a line connecting the end points of the arc to form a closed loop: - Start Point: (0.4307, 0.4071) - End Point: (0.3193, 0.4071) Extrusion for Part 1 Once the 2D sketch has been completed, begin the 3D transformation by scaling the 2D sketch with a scaling factor of 0.75. Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Finally, to complete Part 1, extrude the 2D sketch according to the following properties: - Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.0857 - Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 - Sketch Scale: 0.75 - Operation: Create a new solid body Dimensions of Part 1 - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.0857 - Height: 0.75</description>
